reviews.title: They hang on to your money
reviews.text: When an account matures do not expect to get your money back quickly, as with other financial bodies. They run a Mickey Mouse system. The account matures at midnight - money back next day - no chance. money back maybe three days later - no interest paid for the three days. Matures midnight Friday Saturday, Sunday, then three days. I hope you are not in a hurry to get your money - good luck with that,

reviews.title: Unnecessary cost and delay to get money after a death
reviews.text: Furness building society insist that you apply for Probate if someone passes away and their account holds more than £15,000, even if the money is being transferred to a spouse. Probate will cost a minimum of £215 and it will take at least 6 weeks. At a time when people are at their most vulnerable, Furness Building Society insist that you incur unnecessary costs and delays. Other banks and building societies allow you to withdraw the money without getting probate. Aging or ill account holders may want to consider using another Bank or Building Society.

reviews.title: Fast easy opening of Regular savings account
reviews.text: I have always been attracted to Furness Building Society all through my adult life they have supported me with their products, I have planned for my retirement which includes saving for future things, Car, House repair etc, I therefore opened a regular saver account this allows me to save a substantial amount every month and receive a very good interest rate.

reviews.title: Traditional banking at its best
reviews.text: Furness Building Society provide an incredible in branch service. The staff (in any of their branches) have never been anything other than friendly, professional, polite and helpful. They always take an interest in my family, don't constantly pressure me to take out new products and, best of all, still have passbooks.

reviews.title: Just opened an anniversary regular…
reviews.text:
Just opened an anniversary regular saver with Furness BS. Mightily impressed. Opened the account very shortly after it became available on line and within less than 10 minutes everything was up and running. Sent first monthly deposit even though it failed COP (as expected so soon after opening) and just waiting for it to show on line, probable tomorrow.

For any Building Society, never mind a small one, the service has been impressive. Some of these others that open attractive accounts and then get stuck, unable to cope, should take lessons from Furness

reviews.title: Disgusting customer service. No support. No help. Avoid.
reviews.text:
I had a 2-year fixed mortgage with Furness. Halfway through, I finally found the courage to leave an abusive partner. That decision left me jobless, with no income and nowhere to turn.

I immediately told Furness about my situation, hoping for even the smallest bit of understanding or support. Instead, I was met with cold indifference. When my fixed term ended, my mortgage payments doubled overnight. Their only response: “You have to pay it.”

I filed a complaint, desperate for help, only to be told that everything they did was “justified.” For over nearly 2 and a half years my home stood empty as I struggled to pick up the pieces of my life—while they showed not a shred of compassion or empathy.

Now that I’ve finally sold the property, I can only warn others: Furness offered me nothing but cruelty and disregard at the lowest point in my life. No support. No humanity. No help.

reviews.title: No response from online forms
reviews.text:
Filled in the online enquiry form for a new mortgage and never received a response. Called into a branch and asked and was just told I had to ring up to chase. 
Would have liked to have used a local BS but had no response from them!

reviews.title: infuriating registration process
reviews.text: It is almost as if the identity verification process has been designed specifically to frustrate your ability to apply for a simple savings account. Round and round in circles you go - nothing will satisfy the bot whose job it is to capture your likeness - and no working option to upload manually. A headache inducing waste of time.

reviews.title: Why change a working website???
reviews.text:
When I placed savings with them in 2021 I had access to my savings online.  For reasons known only to them, they then decided to create a new website and I cannot now access my accounts online.
I took note of the email I received a few months ago  and decided to register. WHAT A MISTAKE!!
Because I have to take a photograph of me and my passport I have to do this on a mobile device - why  ?  Other companies allow a scan of my passport !  But I persevered and used my tablet. The registration process broke down 5 times, and each time all the information was lost and I had to re-start. On the 5th time I decided enough is enough, I have better things to do with my time ! Why change a working website???

I have to say fern worked extremely hard and got done what I needed as promised with no stress. Thankyou again fern

Supporting the Mutuals has probably never been more important as they can provide good old-fashion service along with the flexibility and transactional speed of a digital platform. Forgot to ask the lady's name; but thank you for your help and for being so patient with my hearing impairment.

reviews.title: Ridiculous  bureaucracy
reviews.text:
I wanted to open a monthly saver account. You can't do it online. When I sent the application form and cheque, they said I need to send two pieces of ID  signed by a doctor, solicitor etc.
This is crazy and utterly unnecessary.
The annoying thing is that I was a previous member -so I'm sure all my details would still be on their records
I was going to say that Furness Building Society need to move into the 21st Century but I don't think they've even reached the 20th Century yet- they  are stuck in the 19th Century

reviews.title: Refused mortgage at 11th hour
reviews.text:
Had a mortgage agreed in principle prior to the mini budget. Valuer raised issue with a stepped crack, agreed to get all reports requested included structural engineer and drainage. 
Confirmed issue and solution to address. Furness requested quote from builder which we obtained, total cost under £2000
At the 11th hour refused to mortgage. Clearly has no intention of allowing repair to be undertaken. Most likely didn’t want to commit to a low interest rate!! 
AVOID and go with a sensible lender
